input: 🎵Music🎵 Presumably you can hear this.
translatedText: 🎵音乐🎵想必你 能听到这个。

input: There's some construction happening in the house next door, and for the last hour or maybe two hours or so, it seems like this is the ground-smashing portion of whatever construction they're doing, and just the whole house has been shaking, which you will be able to hear if they continue.
translatedText: 隔壁的房子正在施工，在过去的一个小 时或者两个小时左右的时间里，无论 他们正在进行什么施工，这似乎都是地 面粉碎的部分，整个房子一直在摇晃 ，这如果他们继续，您将能够听到。

input: I think it's still going on now.
translatedText: 我认为现在这种情况仍在继续。

input: So if you're curious, that's what the sound is.
translatedText: 所以如果你好奇的话，那就是声音。

input: Now in one of the intro questions that you were just answering, you are actually going to have your mind primed to think about what we're going to talk about today.
translatedText: 现在，在您刚刚回答的介绍性问题之一中，您 实际上将准备好思考我们今天要讨论的内容。

input: This question just made me laugh so much to write it and try to think it through.
translatedText: 这个问题让我笑得很厉害，所以我写下了它并尝试思考它。

input: It's asking if x is the number that most people are going to enter into this box, what is 2 to the x going to be?
translatedText: 它询问 x 是否是大多数人要输入到此框 中的数字，那么 x 的 2 等于多少？

input: And it's just so mind-confuddling, because you think about, okay, if a lot of people are entering 1, I should enter 2, but everyone would think about that, so maybe I should enter 4, but everyone thinks about that, so I should do 2 to the 4, or maybe 2 to the that, or maybe 2 to the that.
translatedText: 这真是令人困惑，因为你会想，好吧，如果很多 人都输入 1，我应该输入 2，但每个人都会 想到这一点，所以也许我应该输入 4，但每 个人都会想到这一点，所以我应该对 4 做 2，或者对那个做 2，或者对那个做 2。

input: And if it was a room full of perfect logicians, you'd blow up to infinity, but people aren't logicians, and there is some objectively correct answer, and we can take a look at what the objectively correct answer is in this context.
translatedText: 如果这是一个充满完美逻辑学家的房间，你会爆炸到无穷 大，但人们不是逻辑学家，并且存在一些客观正确的答案 ，我们可以看看在这种情况下客观正确的答案是什么。

input: And it would appear most, okay, the largest number of people entered 2, which means anyone who entered 4 is absolutely correct.
translatedText: 而且会出现最多，好吧，最多的人输入了2， 也就是说任何输入4的人都是绝对正确的。

input: But in the game where you imagine thinking through, you know, the perfect logicians, and you're taking 2 to the 2 to the 2 to the 2, you're starting to think about the topic for today's video, which is an operation that's not typically taught in school, probably because it doesn't have the same level of applications as certain other ones.
translatedText: 但是在游戏中，你想象通过完美的逻辑学家进 行思考，并且你将 2 到 2 到 2 到 2，你开始思考今天视频的主题，这是 一个运算这通常不会在学校教授，可能是因 为它没有与某些其他课程相同的应用水平。

input: But as you'll see, there's a couple puzzles that we can start to do with it that absolutely bring out some very important problem-solving skills and ideas of just really thinking through what terms actually mean and whether or not operations that you're doing that seem to make sense when you do it symbolically actually make sense when you think through what's really going on.
translatedText: 但正如您将看到的，我们可以开始解决几个难题，这些 难题绝对会带来一些非常重要的解决问题的技巧和想 法，即真正思考术语的实际含义以及您是否正在执行 操作当你象征性地这样做时，这样做似乎是有意义的 ，当你思考到底发生了什么时，实际上是有意义的。

input: So this operation is called tetration, and a way you might think about it is, you know, we all learn about addition as one of the first things, the way that we can add two numbers, and multiplication, as we first see it, is repeated addition.
translatedText: 所以这个操作称为四分法，你可能会想到它的一种方式是，你知 道，我们都将加法作为第一件事来学习，我们可以将两个数字 相加，以及乘法，正如我们第一次看到的那样，是重复加法。

input: A times B is A plus A plus A plus A, B different times.
translatedText: A乘B就是A加A加A加A，B不同的时间。

input: And if you say, well, what happens if we repeat multiplication, you know, taking A times A times A times A, B different times, we write it as A to the power B, and that's exponentiation.
translatedText: 如果你说，好吧，如果我们重复乘法会发生什么，你知道 ，将 A 乘以 A 乘以 A 乘以 A，B 不同次 数，我们将其写为 A 的 B 次方，这就是求幂。

input: Now, if you were to go one step further in this process and say, what happens if we repeat exponentiation, this has a name.
translatedText: 现在，如果您在这个过程中更进一步并说，如 果我们重复求幂会发生什么，这有一个名字。

input: We call it tetration.
translatedText: 我们称之为四分法。

input: Tetra comes from the Greek for four, because it's sort of the fourth stage in this process of repeatedly applying the previous operation.
translatedText: Tetra 来自希腊语，意思是“ 四”，因为它是重复应用先前操作过程中的第四阶段。

input: And of course, in the context of things like multiplication, we've extended the idea beyond just counting numbers.
translatedText: 当然，在乘法之类的背景下，我们已 经将这个想法扩展到了数字之外。

input: So here this only makes sense if B was a counting number, but we do things like taking pi times E, or even complex values, where you can take the square root of two times one plus i.
translatedText: 所以这里只有当 B 是一个计数数字时这才有意义， 但是我们会做一些事情，比如取 pi 乘以 E，甚 至是复数值，你可以取两倍 1 加 i 的平方根。

input: So we've extended it beyond repeated addition, but that's sort of its origin, that's the way that we often start thinking about it.
translatedText: 因此，我们将其扩展到重复加法之外，但这就是 它的起源，这就是我们经常开始思考它的方式。

input: Similarly, very famously, one thing we've been talking a fair about in this series is extending exponentiation with the classic Euler's formula example.
translatedText: 同样，非常著名的是，我们在本系列中一直在讨论的 一件事是使用经典的欧拉公式示例来扩展幂运算。

input: But for right now, we're just going to think of this tetration in terms of repeating an integer number of times.
translatedText: 但现在，我们只考虑重复整数次的四次运算。

input: Do you hear it?
translatedText: 你听到了吗？

input: I swear, we were so dreading the idea that the ground-smashing day would come during one of the streams, but here we are.
translatedText: 我发誓，我们非常害怕在其中一条溪 流中发生毁灭性的一天，但我们来了。

input: Now, this is actually ambiguous if we don't define our terms a little bit more clearly, because exponentiation is not associative, meaning the order that we do these operations and start collapsing it matters.
translatedText: 现在，如果我们不更清楚地定义我们的术语，这实 际上是不明确的，因为求幂不是结合性的，这意味 着我们执行这些操作并开始折叠它的顺序很重要。

input: Because if I was going from left to right, let's say I was writing this as two squared, and then I'm going to think of squaring that, and then squaring the result, that will get me a different number than if I think of going from the top to the bottom.
translatedText: 因为如果我从左到右，假设我将其写成两个平方， 然后我会考虑对其进行平方，然后对结果进行平方 ，这将得到与我想到的不同的数字从顶部到底部。

input: If the first thing I evaluate is the two to the power two at the top, and then I go to the next one, and we can think about why.
translatedText: 如果我评估的第一件事是顶部的2的2次方， 然后我转到下一个，我们可以思考为什么。

input: Here, if I'm collapsing from the bottom, that bottom part is four, so then I square it, and I'll square that.
translatedText: 在这里，如果我从底部塌陷，那么底部是四，所以我将其平方，然后将其平方。

input: Four squared is sixteen, so I square that, and I end up getting 256.
translatedText: 四的平方等于十六，所以我将其平方，最终得到 256。

input: But on the bottom, if I start by collapsing that top term, it becomes a four.
translatedText: 但在底部，如果我首先折叠上面的项，它就会变成四。

input: And then if I think of collapsing the current top term, that becomes two to the sixteen, and that's a much bigger number.
translatedText: 然后，如果我考虑折叠当前的最高项，那就变成二 到十六，这是一个更大的数字。

input: That is 65,536.
And in general, this process of repeatedly exponentiating going from the top to the bottom explodes very quickly, and tetration in general refers to the top to the bottom part.
translatedText: 一般来说，这种从上到下的反复取幂的过程爆炸得 非常快，而四次幂一般指的是从上到下的部分。

input: So we start evaluating at the top, and we work down.
translatedText: 因此，我们从顶部开始评估，然后向下工作。

input: If you want to make that crystal clear, I think instead of drawing it as a power tower, one thing that you could do is define the iterative process very exactly.
translatedText: 如果你想让它变得清晰，我认为你可以做的一件事就是非 常精确地定义迭代过程，而不是把它画成一座电力塔。

input: You might say we have some value that we're going to start out at one, and then each successive value is going to be two to the power of the previous thing.
translatedText: 你可能会说我们有一些值，我们将从 1 开始， 然后每个连续的值将是前一个值的 2 次幂。

input: So a sub one would just be two.
translatedText: 所以一个子一就是两个。

input: a sub two is going to be two to the power of whatever a sub one was, which in this case is two squared.
translatedText: 子二将是二的子一的幂，在这种情况下是二的平方。

input: a sub three is going to be two to the power of whatever a sub two was, which now is two to the two to the two.
translatedText: 子三将是二的二的幂，无论子二是什么，现在是二比二比二。

input: And there's no more ambiguity for what the order of operation should be, because you see that it came from the a two term, so we should first be evaluating what's in the top.
translatedText: 对于操作顺序应该是什么不再有歧义，因为你看到它 来自两个术语，所以我们应该首先评估顶部的内容。

input: And similarly, if you go on like this, and a sub n for any value n is equal to two to the previous term, a sub n minus one, when you unfold this expression and kind of go back in our recursive definition, what you're going to get is a power tower of two n different times.
translatedText: 同样，如果你继续这样下去，任何值 n 的 sub n 等于前一项 的二，即 sub n 减一，当你展开这个表达式并返回到我们的递归 定义中时，你会得到什么我们将要得到的是两个n个不同时间的能量塔。

input: Now another thing that's nice about writing it like this is we can become experimental.
translatedText: 现在，像这样编写它的另一个好处是我们可以进行实验。

input: And as you all know, I love to encourage people to be very playful when you come across a new operation like this, and a lot in this series we've just been pulling up some Python to do that.
translatedText: 众所周知，我喜欢鼓励人们在遇到这样的新操作时保持幽默感，在本系列 的很多内容中，我们只是使用了一些 Python 来做到这一点。

input: So let's do that here.
translatedText: 那么让我们在这里这样做吧。

input: Let's take this iterative process and see what it actually looks like.
translatedText: 让我们看看这个迭代过程，看看它实际上是什么样子。

input: So I will go over to my terminal, I will open up some Python, I will set an initial value of a to be one, and then what I want to do is take a look at two to the power of that, but I'm going to reassign that value into a, so this double asterisk, that's how we take powers in Python, and then in a lot of programming languages, a single equal sign, it's not a question, it's not asking if they're equal, it's an operation.
translatedText: 因此，我将转到我的终端，打开一些 Python，将 a 的初始值设置为 1，然后我想做的是查看 2 的幂，但我'我将把这个值重新分配 给a，所以这个双星号，这就是我们在Python中获取权力的方式，然后在 很多编程语言中，一个等号，这不是一个问题，它不是在问它们是否相等，这是 一个手术。

input: It's saying take whatever's sitting on that right side and shove it into the left value.
translatedText: 它的意思是取出右侧的所有内容并将其推入左侧值。

input: So when we do this, it reassigns the value of a to be two to whatever it was before.
translatedText: 因此，当我们这样做时，它将 a 的值重新分配为 2，无论它之前是什么。

input: This can be bizarre to people who haven't done programming because it seems like you have an equation that you're solving for something.
translatedText: 对于没有编程过的人来说，这可能会很奇怪，因为你似乎有一个正在求解某个方程的方程。

input: But in this case, the left hand side is getting changed, it's an operation on it.
translatedText: 但在本例中，左侧正在发生变化，这是对其进行的操作。

input: So if I do that again, I take that same process of turning a into two to the power of whatever it was before, and then I'll just print it out in the same line, so we can say it turns into four, that turns into 16, that is going to turn into, you can try to make a prediction here, it will turn into two to the 16, which we just saw was 65,536.
translatedText: 因此，如果我再次这样做，我会采取相同的过程，将 a 变成 2 的幂，然 后我会在同一行中将其打印出来，所以我们可以说它变成了 4，即变成16 ，就是要变成，这里你可以尝试做一下预测，它会变成2到16，我们刚才看到 的是65,536。

input: If I take one more step, which would be a power tower of height five, so just five twos stacked on top of each other, it totally explodes.
translatedText: 如果我再迈出一步，这将是一座五层高的能 量塔，所以只要五个二元堆叠在一起，它就会完全爆炸。

input: It's just this monstrous number, which I think it's awfully kind of Python to even do the work to find the number for us.
translatedText: 这只是一个巨大的数字，我认为 Python 甚至可以为我们找到这个数字，这真是太棒了。

input: I'm impressed with it.
translatedText: 我对此印象深刻。

input: And if we wanted, we could say, okay, think of that number as a string, what's the length of that string, and it's telling us the number of digits that are in it.
translatedText: 如果我们愿意，我们可以说，好吧，将该数字视为 一个字符串，该字符串的长度是多少，它告诉我们其中的位数。

input: So the number we have there is a 19,000 digit expression, just monstrously huge.
translatedText: 所以我们得到的数字有 19,000 位数字的表达，实在是太大了。

input: And if we were to try one more iteration of this, turning a into two to the power of that 19,000 digit monstrosity, you would not be able to store the information required for that number.
translatedText: 如果我们再尝试一次这样的迭代，将 1 变成 2 的 1 9,000 位数字的幂，您将无法存储该数字所需的信息。

input: Any way that you were using matter to encode all the digits of whatever would come out, if that was within the confines of something like the radius of the Earth, you would absolutely create a black hole in any attempt to store that kind of information.
translatedText: 任何使用物质对所有数字进行编码的方式，如 果在地球半径之类的范围内，那么在任何存 储此类信息的尝试中绝对会创建一个黑洞。

input: So just a power tower of height six, and it's well beyond what you can literally physically convey in any kind of way.
translatedText: 所以只是一座六高的电力塔，它远远超出了你可以以任何方式实际表达的范围。

input: So, you might ask, how quickly does this thing blow up for other numbers, if it's not two?
translatedText: 那么，你可能会问，如果不是两个，那么对于其他数字来说，这个东西爆炸的速度有多快？

input: And one thing that I'm going to ask you, actually just in the live poll, let's go ahead and pull it up, is to predict what's going to happen here if instead of two, we were dealing with 1.1.
translatedText: 我要问你的一件事，实际上只是在现场民意调查中，让我们继续把它拉起 来，是预测如果我们处理的是 1 而不是 2，这里会发生什么。1.

input: So if you go to the link that's in the description and up on the screen to answer the live questions along with us, we are asked, let B equal 1.1, so just a little above one, and consider an expression of the form B to the B to the B to the B, this power tower, and its height is N, meaning you'll see N different copies of B.
translatedText: 因此，如果您转到描述中以及屏幕上的链接与我们一起回答实时问题，我 们会被问到，让 B 等于 1。1，所以就在上面一点，考虑一个形 式为 B 到 B 到 B 到 B 的表达式，这个能量塔，它 的高度是 N，这意味着你会看到 B 的 N 个不同副本。

input: How big does N have to be?
translatedText: N 必须有多大？

input: How many times do you have to repeat this operation before the value of the expression has more than 10 digits?
translatedText: 在表达式的值超过 10 位之前，需要重复此操作多少次？

input: So with two, we had to get to a tower of size five before that happened.
translatedText: 因此，有了两个，我们必须在那之前到达一座五号塔。

input: It jumped from being a five-digit number to a 19,000-digit number.
translatedText: 它从一个五位数字跃升至一万九千位数字。

input: So how many times would you have to do it for a value of B equals 1.1?
translatedText: 那么如果 B 的值等于 1，您需要执行多少次。1？

input: And I'll give you a moment to answer that while we listen to the soothing tones of construction maybe slowing down.
translatedText: 我会给你一点时间来回答这个问题，同时我们会听到施工进度可能放缓的舒缓音调。

input: And just to illustrate this process here, if we hop back over to Python, and let me just pop on over here, get back into my terminal, let's say I started A at a value of one.
translatedText: 为了在这里说明这个过程，如果我们跳回 Pytho n，让我直接跳到这里，回到我的终端，假设我以 1 的值启动 A。

input: Let's just do this in a for loop, so for N in some kind of range like 50.
translatedText: 让我们在 for 循环中执行此操作，因此 for N 在某种范围（例如 50）内。

input: I'm going to reassign A.
translatedText: 我要重新分配A。

input: What if instead of doing repeated exponentiation, I was just repeatedly multiplying it by 1.1?
translatedText: 如果我不是重复求幂，而是重复乘以 1，会怎么样？1？

input: So just repeated multiplication, which should be exponentiation.
translatedText: 所以只是重复乘法，这应该是幂。

input: You can get a sense of how quickly that grows, and if we take a look here at the first 50 values, you know, it starts at 1.1, it goes to 1.21, and at each stage it's actually growing just by a little bit, by 10% with each jump, and you get classic exponential growth.
translatedText: 您可以了解增长的速度，如果我们看一下前 50 个值，您知道，它从 1 开始。1，则变为 1。21，在每个阶段，它实际上只是增长一点点，每次跳跃增 长 10%，你会得到经典的指数增长。

input: So with 50 steps it took us up to 117.
translatedText: 走了 50 步，我们就走到了 117 步。

input: That's exponential growth.
translatedText: 这是指数级增长。

input: So you might wonder, what is tetrational growth?
translatedText: 所以你可能想知道，什么是四列生长？

input: What happens if we're repeatedly exponentiating this thing?
translatedText: 如果我们反复对这个东西求幂会发生什么？

input: And before I answer that, let me see what you think.
translatedText: 在我回答之前，让我看看你的想法。

input: What do you think is going to happen here if we repeatedly exponentiate this?
translatedText: 如果我们反复对其求幂，你认为会发生什么？

input: Okay.
translatedText: 好的。

input: So the correct answer is that it actually never grows past anything like that.
translatedText: 所以正确的答案是它实际上永远不会超过这样的程度。

input: And, ah, interesting, that's the third placed answer.
translatedText: 而且，啊，有趣的是，这是第三位的答案。

input: So most of you thought that the height that you would need would be between 10 and 100.
translatedText: 所以大多数人认为您需要的高度在 10 到 100 之间。

input: Doing it between 10 and 100 times, that would blow you up past 10 digits.
translatedText: 重复 10 到 100 次，你的成绩就会突破 10 位数。

input: The second most common answer was thinking it was between 1 and 10, which would be very analogous to how 2 was growing.
translatedText: 第二个最常见的答案是认为它在 1 到 10 之间，这与 2 的增长方式非常相似。

input: Third most common, and I'm wondering how many of those third most common people have seen this process before, because it's very weird, the idea that repeatedly multiplying it by itself, that'll grow as much as you want, but that somehow doing what feels like a much more powerful operation, repeatedly exponentiating, that actually stays confined.
translatedText: 第三个最常见的，我想知道有多少第三个最常见的人以前见过这个过程，因 为它很奇怪，反复乘以它本身的想法，它会像你想要的那样增长，但不知 何故做感觉像是一个更强大的操作，反复求幂，但实际上仍然受到限制。

input: And we can see this bear out in practice if we hop back over to our Python, where now what I'm doing with each iteration, and I guess I should set a to be 1 again, I'm going to repeatedly turn it into 1 to the power of itself.
translatedText: 如果我们跳回 Python，我们可以在实践中看到这一点，现在我在每次迭代中所 做的事情，我想我应该再次将 a 设置为 1，我将反复将其变成1 自身的幂。

input: And what we get is a little bit of initial growth, but it quickly slows down, and just within 20 iterations, it actually stays fixed at this value.
translatedText: 我们得到的是一点点初始增长，但它很快减慢，并且在 20 次迭代内 ，它实际上保持固定在这个值。

input: You can see that this digit isn't changing.
translatedText: 您可以看到这个数字没有改变。

input: And if you think through what's going on there, evidently when a is equal to that value, and you take 1.1 to the power of that value, so 1.1 to the power of this thing that's 1.1117, ah, don't type it too many times, that actually stays fixed.
translatedText: 如果你仔细想想那里发生了什么，显然当 a 等于该值时，你就取 1。1 的该值次方，因此 1 。1 的 1 次方。1117，啊，别打太多次，那实际上是固定的。

input: You get the same value that you had before.
translatedText: 您将获得与以前相同的价值。

input: So another way that we can phrase this is to say that the equation 1.1 to the power x equals x, something where when you plug it into the function you get itself, this has a solution.
translatedText: 因此，我们可以用另一种方式表述这一点，即方程 1。1 的 x 次方等 于 x，当你将它插入到你得到的函数中时，这就有了一个解决方案。

input: This didn't hold when we were doing it with 2.
translatedText: 当我们用 2 来做这件事时，这并不成立。

input: If we had 2 to the x equals x, if you try to think through different answers to this, it's a funky equation to think about, but if you just try out some values like 0 and 1 or anything in between, you'll find there's actually no answer here, whereas evidently we just saw an answer in this case.
translatedText: 如果我们有 2 到 x 等于 x，如果你尝试思考这个问题 的不同答案，这是一个值得思考的时髦方程，但如果你只是尝试一些值，如 0 和 1 或介于 两者之间的任何值，你会发现实际上这里没有答案，而显然我们只是在这种情况下看到了答案。

input: And what that means for our iterative process, if instead of 2 at the base it was 1.1 at the base, you'd have the situation where the previous value, you raise 1.1 to that, it just stays fixed.
translatedText: 如果底层不是 2，而是 1，这对我们的迭代过程意味着什么。基数为 1，就会出现前一个值加 1 的情况。1 对此，它只是保持固定。

input: And now this starts raising a lot of interesting questions.
translatedText: 现在这开始引发很多有趣的问题。

input: First of all, where's the switch?
translatedText: 首先，开关在哪里？

input: What number between 1 and 2 is the point where it goes from staying finite to blowing up?
translatedText: 1 到 2 之间的哪个数字是它从有限到爆炸的点？

input: And blowing up incredibly quickly at that, remember with 2 it only took us 5 iterations before we had something that was, you know, beyond what the computer could handle.
translatedText: 爆炸速度非常快，请记住，在 2 中，我们只花了 5 次迭代，就得到了超出计算机处理能力的东西。

input: And we could play around with this a little bit, but I think another interesting product of the fact that this can converge at all, is we can start answering what look like very bizarre questions, where I can say, imagine I have an unknown value x, and I do not a power tower of some finite size, but of an infinite size.
translatedText: 我们可以稍微尝试一下，但我认为这可以收敛的事实的另一个有趣的产品是我们可 以开始回答看起来非常奇怪的问题，我可以说，想象我有一个未知的值x，我没有 一个有限尺寸的能量塔，而是一个无限尺寸的能量塔。

input: I'm going to keep going forever, in the same way that evidently I can do with a base of 1.1.
translatedText: 我将永远继续 下去，就像我可以以 1 为底一样。1.

input: Can I find a value of x where this converges, for example to 4?
translatedText: 我能否找到一个收敛的 x 值，例如收敛到 4？

input: This is the question posed in the thumbnail of the video.
translatedText: 这是视频缩略图中提出的问题。

input: And what we just saw is that we could find a value that converges to 1.111782 on and on, that's evidently a value you can converge to, and the solution would be 1.1, but how do you go the other way around?
translatedText: 我们刚刚看到的是，我们可以找到一个收敛于 1 的值。111782 等 等，这显然是一个可以收敛到的值，解就是 1。1、但是反过来怎么办呢？

input: How can we actually solve for the idea that we can find a value of x that equals 4?
translatedText: 我们如何才能真正解决这样的问题：我们可以找到等于 4 的 x 值？

input: And there's a clever trick here that you might spot, and this comes up in certain problem solving kinds of math, where you have this infinite expression, and you say, hmm, there's some self-similarity I can leverage.
translatedText: 这里有一个聪明的技巧，你可能会发现，这出现在某些数学问题解决类 型中，你有无限的表达式，你会说，嗯，我可以利用一些自相似性。

input: There's a copy of the entire power tower inside itself.
translatedText: 其内部有整个能量塔的副本。

input: Because it's infinite, it's a genuine copy of itself.
translatedText: 因为它是无限的，所以它是它自身的真实复制品。

input: It's not, it doesn't have a height of 1 minus whatever the previous height was, because the height is infinity.
translatedText: 事实并非如此，它的高度不是 1 减去之前的高度，因为高度是无穷大。

input: And under the assumption that the whole power tower equals 4, I could replace that with a 4 and solve x to the 4th equals 4.
translatedText: 假设整个电力塔等于 4，我可以将其替换为 4，并求解 x 到第 4 个等于 4。

input: Let's see, what would that be?
translatedText: 让我们看看，那会是什么？

input: If I take square roots, that's the same as saying x squared equals 2.
translatedText: 如果我取平方根，就相当于 x 的平方等于 2。

input: So it looks like, interesting, x equals square root of 2 gives me a power tower that should converge to 4.
translatedText: 所以看起来很有趣，x 等于 2 的平方根给了我一个应该收敛到 4 的能量塔。

input: Kind of funky.
translatedText: 有点时髦。

input: The idea that anything converges at all is sort of weird, but the idea that, you know, square root of 2 would go to a clean value, like an integer, that's kind of surprising.
translatedText: 任何东西都会收敛的想法有点奇怪，但你知道，2 的平方根会变成一个干净的值，比如整数，这有点令人惊讶。

input: And let me actually ask you another question, where I'm going to have you apply the same tactic that we just did, leveraging that self-similarity to solve another one of these situations, where you're looking for a power tower with an unknown base, and seeing when it equals a pre-specified value.
translatedText: 让我实际上问你另一个问题，我将让你应用我们刚才所做的相同策略，利用这种自相似性来 解决另一种情况，即你正在寻找一个带有未知的底数，并查看它何时等于预先指定的值。

input: So this time the question is going to ask us, if we give it just a little moment to pull up here, well it's taking a little moment, which is fine, ah great, the question asks us, using the tactic just demonstrated, what I just did for 4, solve the equation x to the x to the x on and on up to infinity equals 2.
translatedText: 所以这一次的问题会问我们，如果我们给它一点点时间来停在这里，那么它需要一 点时间，这很好，啊太棒了，问题问我们，使用刚才演示的策略，什么我刚刚对 4 进行了求解，求解方程 x 到 x 到 x 一直到无穷大等于 2。

input: So I'll give you a moment to think that through.
translatedText: 所以我会给你一点时间思考一下。

input: The ground smasher is back.
translatedText: 地面粉碎机又回来了。

input: Man, yesterday when we were doing it, we, I wish I had the footage to show you, maybe I can try to pull it up on my phone or something, but the things were shaking so much that just a pile of circuit boards was actively shaking.
translatedText: 伙计，昨天我们做的时候，我们，我希望我有录像给你看，也许我可以尝试把它拉到 我的手机或其他东西上，但是东西摇晃得太厉害了，只剩下一堆电路板了主动摇晃。

input: Let me see if I can find this, it's super funny.
translatedText: 让我看看我是否能找到这个，这太有趣了。

input: Alright, this might not, this is probably the worst way to stream something, is to take an overhead camera shot of a phone, but let me see if this works decently well.
translatedText: 好吧，这可能不是，这可能是最糟糕的流媒体方式，就是用手机拍摄头顶摄像头照片，但让我看看这是否能正常工作。

input: So I was trying to get a view of the construction, we move over, and just the pile of circuit boards is just jittering like that.
translatedText: 所以我试图看一下结构，我们移过去，只是一堆电路板就像那样在抖动。

input: And that's what we have to deal with, so hope you enjoy.
translatedText: 这就是我们必须处理的，所以希望你喜欢。

input: Now on the quiz, it looks like just about everybody is converging around the same answer, and I'm going to assume you've landed on the correct answer, which is in fact the square root of 2, which is kind of a funny thing, because if we go and we do exactly the same logic that we were doing for solving for 4, where we have this infinite power tower, and we're assuming that it equals 2, and we recognize the self-similarity, we're like, ah yes, the power tower, copy of it in itself, so that should mean x squared equals 2, that means x equals the square root of 2.
translatedText: 现在在测验中，看起来几乎每个人都集中在相同的答案上，我假设你已经找到了正确的答案，这实际上是 2 的平方根，这有点有趣事情，因为如果我们执行与求解 4 完全相同的逻辑，我们有一个无限 的能量塔，并且我们假设它等于 2，并且我们认识到自相似性，我们'就像，啊，是的，电 力塔，它本身的副本，所以这应该意味着 x 平方等于 2，这意味着 x 等于 2 的平方根。

input: Well hang on a second, this can't be right, because on the one hand this seems to be suggesting that an infinite power tower converges to 2 when the base is root 2, but on the other hand it converges to 4 when the base is root 2.
translatedText: 等一下，这不可能是正确的，因为一方面，这似乎表明，当底数为 2 时，无限 能量塔会收敛到 2，但另一方面，当底数为 2 时，它会收敛到 4是根2。

input: It can't be both, we've got a very deterministic process up here for what it converges, so it's got to be just one of them, if any.
translatedText: 不可能两者兼而有之，我们在这里有一个非常确定性的过程来收敛，所以它必须只是其中之一（如果有的话）。

input: Maybe the entire logic of the situation is false.
translatedText: 也许整个情况的逻辑都是错误的。

input: So, let's get empirical.
translatedText: 那么，让我们来实证一下。

input: Let's turn to our programming to see which one of these it actually ends up being.
translatedText: 让我们转向我们的编程，看看它实际上最终会成为其中的哪一个。

input: So I'll hop back over, I will reassign my variable a to be 1, I'm going to make my little loop, actually let's import math because I'm going to need a square root here.
translatedText: 所以我会跳回来，我会将我的变量 a 重新分配为 1，我将进行我的小循环，实际上让我们导入数学，因为我需要在这里求平方根。

input: So I'm going to say for, I don't know, we'll just do 20 at a time.
translatedText: 所以我想说，我不知道，我们一次只做 20 个。

input: I'm going to take a, turn it into the square root of 2, square root of 2 to the power of a, print out what it looks like, guess I don't need that semicolon, but it doesn't really matter.
translatedText: 我要把a，把它转成2的平方根，2的平方根的a次方，打 印出它的样子，我猜我不需要那个分号，但这并不重要。

input: And it looks like for those first 20 iterations it does kind of slow down as it approaches 2, and if I do another 20 iterations, it's definitely slowing down as it gets to 2, definitely, alright.
translatedText: 看起来，对于前 20 次迭代，当它接近 2 时，它确实会变慢，如果我 再进行 20 次迭代，当它达到 2 时，它肯定会变慢，当然，好吧。

input: And now it does something kind of bizarre where it seems like it lands exactly on 2, but then it jumps up to 2.0004, which if you think through what's going on here, at some point it equals 2.
translatedText: 现在它做了一些奇怪的事情，看起来它正好落在 2 上，但随后又跳到了 2。00 04，如果你仔细想想这里发生的事情，在某些时候它等于 2。

input: So we're saying a equals 2, and then we're taking the square root of 2 to the power of that, but square root of 2 to the power of 2 by definition should be 2.
translatedText: 所以我们说 a 等于 2，然后我们取 2 的平方根的 2 次方，但根据定义，2 的 2 次方的平方根应该是 2。

input: So that's going to be just some simple numerical error.
translatedText: 所以这只是一些简单的数字错误。

input: I guess, however, the math square root library is implementing square roots, you know, there's always going to be a little bit of numerical error with floating points, so when we square it we don't exactly get 2 back.
translatedText: 然而，我猜想，数学平方根库正在实现平方根，你 知道，浮点数总是会出现一点数值误差，所以当我 们对其求平方时，我们并不能准确地得到 2。

input: That's fine, not a problem.
translatedText: 这很好，不是问题。

input: But it does seem to suggest that the correct answer to our question of what happens when we have a power tower with root 2 is that it equals 2, or that the sequence of numbers that this represents approaches 2.
translatedText: 但它似乎确实表明，对于我们的问题（当我们有一个根为 2 的电力塔时 会发生什么）的正确答案是它等于 2，或者它代表的数字序列接近 2。

input: What's wrong with the other logic though?
translatedText: 那么其他逻辑有什么问题呢？

input: What's wrong with the logic that seemed to imply that it should equal 4?
translatedText: 似乎意味着它应该等于 4 的逻辑有什么问题？

input: Well to answer that we should do two things.
translatedText: 好吧，回答我们应该做两件事。

input: First is to represent this thing a little bit more visually, a little bit graphically, so we can try to understand what is going on with this iterative process.
translatedText: 首先是更直观地、图形化地表示这个东西，这样我 们就可以尝试理解这个迭代过程中发生了什么。

input: And then from there understand which values will converge and which values will blow up.
translatedText: 然后从那里了解哪些价值观会收敛，哪些价值观会爆炸。

input: And by answering that we can get back in the direction of what's wrong with the logic associated with having this thing approach 4.
translatedText: 通过回答这个问题，我们可以回到与此事物方法 4 相关的逻辑出了什么问题的方向。

input: So for that let's take a look over at our good friend Desmos.
translatedText: 为此，让我们来看看我们的好朋友 Desmos。

input: Pop on over here, open up Chrome, not look at that yet, that is 4 later.
translatedText: 跳到这里，打开 Chrome，还没看，那是 4 以后的事了。

input: And we will just take a look at a graph here.
translatedText: 我们只看一下这里的图表。

input: Alright so what I have is the line y equals x, I've got a function b to the power x and I've set b to be 2, so we're just looking at the graph of 2 to the x.
translatedText: 好吧，我所拥有的是 y 等于 x 的线，我有一个函数 b 的 x 次方，并且我将 b 设置为 2，所以我们只看 2 到 x 的图形。

input: And to think about the idea of repeatedly applying a function and kind of taking the output and then plugging it back into the input, we can draw what's commonly known as a cobweb diagram.
translatedText: 为了考虑重复应用一个函数以及获取输出然后将其插 回输入的想法，我们可以绘制通常所说的蜘蛛网图。

input: The way this will work is I have an initial value of 1 as the input, and then the next value is going to be whatever f of 1 is, I'm going to plug in 1 to the function.
translatedText: 其工作方式是我将初始值 1 作为输入，然后下一个值 将是 1 的 f 的值，我将把 1 插入到函数中。

input: And what that means is I move vertically until I hit the graph, and in this case 2 to the 1 is just 2, so I'm going to hit it at a y value of 2.
translatedText: 这意味着我会垂直移动，直到到达图表，在这种情况下，2 除以 1 就是 2，所以我将在 y 值 2 处到达它。

input: But from there what I want is the output that I just got, that 2, to become an input to the function.
translatedText: 但从那里我想要的是我刚刚得到的输出，即 2，成为函数的输入。

input: But if outputs are represented on the y axis and inputs are on the x axis, what I need is some point where the y value is the same as the x value.
translatedText: 但是，如果输出表示在 y 轴上，输入表示在 x 轴 上，那么我需要的是 y 值与 x 值相同的某个点。

input: So if I walk horizontally until the y value is the same as the x value, I'll get to a point where 2 is the x value, where I can now think of that 2 as being the input.
translatedText: 因此，如果我水平行走直到 y 值与 x 值相同，我将到 达 x 值为 2 的点，现在我可以将 2 视为输入。

input: And to do that, I walk until I hit the line y equals x, because once I hit that I'm looking at 2,2, so I can treat that 2 as an input by moving vertically until I hit the graph, and kind of see how that works, meaning the next point in our iterative process is going to be 2 to the power of what we just had, which is 2 squared, or 4, and then I move over to the right, turning my output into an input, looking for what point on the plane has an x value that's also equal to 4, then once I hit that, I kind of think of bouncing off of this line, y equals x, and moving vertically until I hit the graph again.
translatedText: 为此，我会一直走，直到到达 y 等于 x 的线，因为一 旦到达该线，我就会看到 2,2，因此我可以通过垂直移 动将 2 视为输入，直到到达图形为止，然后键入看看它是 如何工作的，这意味着我们迭代过程中的下一个点将是我们 刚刚得到的 2 次方，即 2 的平方，或 4，然后我向 右移动，将我的输出变成输入，寻找平面上的哪个点的 x 值也等于 4，然后一旦我击中该点，我就会想到从这条线 弹起，y 等于 x，并垂直移动，直到我再次击中图形。

input: And this time it's not until 16 that I hit the graph, and then I move to the right until x also equals 16, and then from there, I have to go quite a while, quite a while moving vertically, but it will happen quite a while, and around 65,000 it intersects the graph again, and then it's going to move to the right until we get to an x coordinate that's also 65,000, and from there, Desmos just totally gives up on trying to draw the next vertical line, because as we saw, what it would have to get to is a height where the number describing that height is a 19,000 digit number, so it just gives up on us there.
translatedText: 这次直到 16 才到达图表，然后我向右移动，直到 x 也等于 16，然后从那里，我必须走很长一段时间，垂直移动很长一段时 间，但这会发生过了一会儿，在 65,000 左右，它再次与图 形相交，然后它将向右移动，直到我们到达同样为 65,000 的 x 坐标，从那里开始，Desmos 完全放弃尝试绘制下一 条垂直线，因为正如我们所看到的，它必须达到一个高度，其中描述 该高度的数字是 19,000 位数字，所以它就放弃了我们。

input: But when we think in terms of these cobweb diagrams, now if I start playing with what is that base, you can see what's going to happen.
translatedText: 但是，当我们考虑这些蜘蛛网图时，如果我现在开始 研究这个基础是什么，你就可以看到会发生什么。

input: What is that base?
translatedText: 那个基地是什么？

input: The base is the ground-smashing activity.
translatedText: 基础是砸地活动。

input: At some point, the graphs actually cross each other.
translatedText: 在某些时候，这些图实际上是相互交叉的。

input: So in particular, we were looking at 1.1 earlier, and that, yeah, they absolutely cross, but even up to around 1.41, which is around the square root of 2, if you look at what happens with this process, we look at the output, turn the output into an input, look at the new output, output into an input, and bounce back and forth, we're bouncing towards the value where these graphs intersect each other, towards the value where b of x, b to the power x, excuse me, is equal to x.
translatedText: 因此，我们特别关注的是 1。1 早些时候，是的，它们绝对交叉，但 甚至达到 1 左右。41，大约是 2 的平方根，如 果你看看这个过程会发生什么，我们看看输出，将输 出变成输入，看看新的输出，输出变成输入，然后来 回反弹，我们弹向这些图彼此相交的值，弹向 x 的 b 值，对不起，b 的 x 次方等于 x。

input: And in particular, if that base was the square root of 2, and I say find a solution of square root of 2 to the power x equals x, you know, it's not easy to think about how you solve this systematically, but for this particular case, you would believe me if I told you that the solution is x equals 2.
translatedText: 特别是，如果这个底是 2 的平方根，我说找到 2 的平方根的 x 次 方等于 x 的解，你知道，思考如何系统地解决这个问题并不容易，但是 对于这个特殊情况下，如果我告诉你解是 x 等于 2，你就会相信我。

input: You can just plug that in and solve it.
translatedText: 您只需将其插入并解决即可。

input: So if we look at our graph, if b, actually let's go ahead and make it precisely the square root of 2, rather than just an approximation here.
translatedText: 因此，如果我们看一下我们的图表，如果 b，实际上让我们继 续将其精确地设为 2 的平方根，而不仅仅是这里的近似值。

input: So b is going to be the square root, square root of 2, no, of 2.
translatedText: 所以 b 将是平方根，2 的平方根，不，2 的平方根。

input: The intersection point is exactly at 2, so you see your iterative process approaching that.
translatedText: 交点正好位于 2 处，因此您会看到迭代过程接近该点。

input: Okay, that's kind of interesting.
translatedText: 好吧，这有点有趣。

input: This also shows us how we're going to need to think about it if we want to be, if we want to understand where the switch happens between when things converge and when things don't converge.
translatedText: 这也向我们展示了如果我们想要的话，如果我们想了解事物收敛 和事物不收敛之间的切换发生在哪里，我们将需要如何思考它。

input: Because what we want is knowing what value of b should I go to where things can escape, there is no intersection point, to where things don't escape, where there is an intersection point.
translatedText: 因为我们想要的是知道b的值是多少，我应该去哪里东西 可以逃逸，没有交点，哪里东西不逃逸，哪里有交点。

input: And by the way, I've left the link to this particular Desmos graph in the description, so if you want to hop down there and just play along, you're more than welcome to.
translatedText: 顺便说一下，我在描述中留下了这个特定 Desmos 图 的链接，所以如果你想跳到那里一起玩，我们非常欢迎你。

input: One thing I should specify, the fact that they intersect, that's actually not enough to ensure that this cobweb iterative process necessarily converges.
translatedText: 我应该指出的一件事是，它们相交这一事实实际 上不足以确保这个蜘蛛网迭代过程必然收敛。

input: It's important that the graph of our function, which in this case is b to the x, intersects at a slope that's less than 1.
translatedText: 重要的是，我们的函数图形（在本例中为 b 与 x）相交的斜率小于 1。

input: And we can think about why that's true.
translatedText: 我们可以思考为什么这是真的。

input: If I turn a new leaf, let's say I wasn't dealing with exponential functions or curves like that, I was just dealing with any generic function.
translatedText: 如果我翻开新的一页，假设我不处理指数函数 或类似的曲线，我只是处理任何通用函数。

input: So look at the line y equals x, and let's say I have some function which squiggles along and it intersects it, but with a slope greater than 1.
translatedText: 看一下 y 等于 x 的线，假设我有一些函数，它 沿着曲线蜿蜒前行，并与它相交，但斜率大于 1。

input: Then when we do our iterative process, we'll have some output, and we say, let's turn it into an input by walking horizontally until we hit y equals x.
translatedText: 然后，当我们进行迭代过程时，我们将得到一些输出，我们说， 让我们通过水平行走将其转换为输入，直到 y 等于 x。

input: Look at the new output by walking vertically.
translatedText: 通过垂直行走查看新的输出。

input: Smash, smash, smash.

input: So we're looking for a system of equations here, and the correct answer, which 1777 of you got, I think that's not quite French Revolution territory, but American Revolution territory of you, we got b to the x equals x, so we need them to intersect, and then moreover what we want is the slope to be the same where they do intersect.

input: And the derivative of b to the x is itself, but scaled by the natural log of b, and we want that slope to equal one, because it's got to be the same as the slope of the graph we're just looking at.

input: And if ever you don't remember what the derivatives of your exponential functions are, if you do remember that e to the x is its own derivative, which if there's any one thing you remember in calculus with respect to e to the x, it should be that e to the x is its own derivative.

input: Note that we can write b as e to the natural log of b, so then all of that to the x.

input: So this is the same as expressing e to the natural log of b times x, we talked about this I think last lecture.

input: So then if you want to take the derivative of this, take its derivative, on the one hand it should be the derivative of this, which by the chain rule is that constant sitting in the exponent, natural log of b times itself, e to the ln b times x.

input: Now to solve this, the first thing I might do is note that I can simplify b to the x as being x, so I would apply that over here, and I can write the natural log of b times x is equal to one.

input: And what that gives me is that b is the same as one divided by x, all very nice, no no no, it doesn't give me that, it gives me that the natural log of b is one over x.

translatedText: 是的，检查了一下，它在 1 之间。44和1。45，这正是我们正在寻找的，即从收敛到爆炸的点。

input: Very satisfying, I think, finding that solution, that it's e to the 1 over e.
translatedText: 我认为找到这个解决方案非常令人满意，它是 e 到 1 的 e 。

input: As a challenge puzzle for you, if you want a little bit of homework today, I want you to find a lower bound on where this converges.
translatedText: 作为对您来说的挑战难题，如果您今天想要一点作业，我希望您找到其收敛的下限。

input: So we found the highest value that will make this converge, but we can also start playing with values of b that are less than 1, and if we do that, I'll just kind of get rid of our cobweb here, if we do that there will be some value, I guess I should keep the cobwebbing, where it's no longer going to zero in on some exact value, and it instead becomes an unstable point.
translatedText: 所以我们找到了使这个收敛的最高值，但我们也可以开始使用小于 1 的 b 值，如果我们这样做，我会在这里摆脱我们的蜘蛛网，如果我们这样做 会有一些价值，我想我应该保留蜘蛛网，它不再会在某个精确值上归零，而是成为一个不稳定点。

input: And the question for you is, when does that happen?
translatedText: 你的问题是，这什么时候发生？

input: When does it go from approaching the point where the two graphs intersect to no longer approaching it, because it's unstable?
translatedText: 它什么时候从接近两个图相交的点变为不再接近它，因为它不稳定？

input: And if you want a hint, think about the fact that the slope, in this case it's not a matter of when it's equal to 1, it's a matter of when it's less than negative 1, and if you want another hint, it should be an expression that also involves two e's inside of it.
translatedText: 如果你想要一个提示，请考虑斜率这一事实，在这种情况下，这不是它何时等于 1 的问题，而是它何时小于负 1 的问题，如果你想要另一个提示，它应该是内部也包含两个 e 的表达式。

input: So, very fun puzzle if you want to get to it, and that will give you kind of a range of convergence for what values could we have as the base in our titration, such that the power tower actually converges to something.
translatedText: 所以，如果你想解决这个问题，这是一个非常有趣的谜题，这将为你提供一系列收敛，以了解我们可以将哪些值作为滴定的基础，以便功率塔实际上收敛到某个值。

input: And one thing that's noteworthy here, is that it goes from converging to a value of e, to just blowing up to infinity, it never converges to values between e and infinity.
translatedText: 这里值得注意的一件事是，它从收敛到 e 值，到爆炸到无穷大，它永远不会收敛到 e 和无穷大之间的值。

input: Which maybe runs against intuition, because you would think that it somehow smoothly blows up, that rather than going, oh it converges to 1, it converges to 2, it converges to e, and then discontinuously jumping to infinity, but that is apparently the behavior.
translatedText: 这可能违背直觉，因为你会认为它以某种方式平滑地爆炸，而不是，哦，它收敛到 1，它收敛到 2，它收敛到 e，然后不连续地跳跃到无穷大，但这显然是行为。

input: And it happens just because the graphs were once tangent, and then that's where they separate.
translatedText: 发生这种情况只是因为图形曾经相切，然后那就是它们分开的地方。

input: They're kissing, and then they stop kissing.
translatedText: 他们接吻，然后停止接吻。

input: And this answers for us what's going on in the case of the power tower with 4.
translatedText: 这为我们解答了 4 号电力塔的情况。

input: So if you think back to the logic, where did we have it?
translatedText: 那么，如果你回想一下逻辑，我们从哪里得到它呢？

input: Great.
translatedText: 伟大的。

input: So if we have our power tower, and I was saying, solve for the value where this equals 4, well this assumes that such a value even exists, that this process will ever converge to be 4.
translatedText: 所以，如果我们有我们的能量塔，我是说，求解等于 4 的值，那么这假设这样的值甚至存在，这个过程将永远收敛到 4。

input: But we just saw that it'll never converge to be anything that's bigger than e.
translatedText: 但我们刚刚看到它永远不会收敛到大于 e 的任何值。

input: So in particular, the very first step where we make the substitution, that's leveraging the assumption that a solution even exists, that's invalid.
translatedText: 因此，特别是，我们进行替换的第一步是利用解决方案甚至存在的假设，这是无效的。

input: And the reason that it worked for 2 is because there does exist a value where this converges to 2, so when we make that initial substitution, that's a valid thing to do.
translatedText: 它对 2 起作用的原因是因为确实存在一个收敛于 2 的值，所以当我们进行初始替换时，这是一个有效的做法。

input: And before we even solved it, you could have seen that there exists a value where it converges to 2 by looking at the graphs.
translatedText: 在我们解决这个问题之前，您可以通过查看图表发现存在一个收敛到 2 的值。

input: What you would look for, even if you didn't know it was going to be square root of 2, what you would look for is when does this intersection point between the graphs happen at a y value of 2?
translatedText: 即使您不知道它会是 2 的平方根，您也会寻找什么，您会寻找的是图形之间的交点何时出现在 2 的任意值处？

input: I guess it's also an x value of 2 because it's on the line y equals x, but what we care about is that the y value should be 2.
translatedText: 我猜它的 x 值也是 2，因为它位于 y 等于 x 的线上，但我们关心的是 y 值应该是 2。

input: And you would be able to empirically start seeing that, hmm, that's somewhere between 1.41 and 1.42, and you could binary search your way on down even a little bit further.
translatedText: 你将能够凭经验开始看到，嗯，它介于 1 之间。41和1。42，你可以进一步向下进行二分搜索。

input: So, I think that's delightful, that you can take a look at this absolutely crazy singing process of a repeated power tower, that it converges at any points at all, which is counterintuitive, and that we can actually make very substantive statements about when it converges, thinking through iterative processes like this.
translatedText: 所以，我认为这是令人高兴的，你可以看看这个重复的电力塔的绝对疯狂的歌唱过程，它在任何点上都会收敛，这 是违反直觉的，而且我们实际上可以对它何时发生做出非常实质性的陈述收敛，通过这样的迭代过程进行思考。

input: And that's actually it for today, this is going to be a shorter lesson.
translatedText: 这实际上就是今天的内容，这将是一个较短的课程。

input: That is the end of what I wanted to say about the power tower puzzle, and leaving you with that little bit of homework.
translatedText: 我想说的有关电力塔谜题的内容到此结束，并给您留下了一点作业。

input: So for the very end here, I just want to take a couple more questions from Twitter, if you ask them with the hashtag locked down math, they might get forwarded to me, and anything about tetration and this process is exactly what we should talk about.
translatedText: 所以在最后，我只想从 Twitter 上问几个问题，如果你用锁定数学的主题标签来问他们，他们可能会转发给我，而关于 tetration 和这个过程的任何事情正是我们应该讨论的关于。

input: Great, so, it says if there's a triangle of exponents, is there a square of tetration?
translatedText: 太好了，那么，它说如果有一个指数三角形，是否有一个四次方？

input: What uses are there for the inverses of tetration?
translatedText: 四分法的逆有什么用处？

input: Well, I mean, in either case, we'd be dealing with three different variables.
translatedText: 嗯，我的意思是，无论哪种情况，我们都会处理三个不同的变量。

input: There's the idea of what's the base, what's the height, and then what's the output.
translatedText: 底数是多少，高度是多少，然后输出是多少。

input: So in either case, we'd just be having three of them.
translatedText: 因此，无论哪种情况，我们都只会拥有其中的三个。

input: The four in tetration, like what makes it four, is not the fact that there's three relevant numbers, you know, the base, the exponent, and then whatever the output, and then some new fourth thing.
translatedText: 四元中的四，就像四的组成部分一样，并不是这样的事实：存在三个相关的数字，你知道，底数，指数，然后无论输出是什么，然后是一些新的第四个东西。

input: It's that in this process of addition, multiplication, exponentiation, it's kind of the fourth of our like, repeating the process before.
translatedText: 就是在这个加法、乘法、求幂的过程中，它有点像我们的第四个，重复之前的过程。

input: Next question from ML, will you show us part of the fractal set of complex numbers x for which the power tower x to the x to the x to the x converges?
translatedText: ML 的下一个问题，您能否向我们展示复数 x 的分形集合的一部分，其中电力塔 x 到 x 到 x 到 x 收敛？

input: I'm so happy that you asked, ML.
translatedText: 我很高兴你问这个问题，ML。

input: Yes, you might wonder what happens if instead of our base equaling two, or instead of our base equaling square root of two, or 1.4, or all the values we were just looking at, what if you have some complex number, like z, that you're raising to a repeated power?
translatedText: 是的，您可能想知道如果我们的基数不等于 2，或者我们的基数不等于 2 的平方根或 1，会发生什么。4，或者我们刚刚看到的所有值，如果你有一些复数，比如 z，你要计算它的重复幂怎么办？

input: Now there's a little bit of nuance there for what exactly it means to raise complex values to other complex values, and I think I'm going to talk about that, don't hold me to it, I think I'll talk about that in the next lecture.
translatedText: 现在，将复数值提升为其他复数值到底意味着什么，这里有一些细微差别，我想我会谈论这个，不要让我坚持下去，我想我会谈论这个在下一个讲座中。

input: It's very similar to what we see with real values where you can re-express it in terms of e, and then because we know how to think about e with complex numbers, you'll be able to do it.
translatedText: 这与我们看到的实值非常相似，您可以用 e 重新表达它，然后因为我们知道如何用复数来思考 e，所以您将能够做到这一点。

input: But if you are willing to grant the fact that there does exist a way that you can extend exponentiation to complex numbers, you could certainly repeat it.
translatedText: 但如果您愿意承认确实存在一种可以将求幂扩展到复数的方法，那么您当然可以重复它。

input: And when you repeat it, you can start asking about, does this converge?
translatedText: 当你重复它时，你可以开始问，这收敛了吗？

input: And if you ask about when it converges, and if you go and you write a shader or whatever your favorite kind of program is to color all the pixels on the plane based on whether or not it converges, this is what you get.
translatedText: 如果你问它何时收敛，并且如果你去编写一个着色器或任何你最喜欢的程序，根据它是否收敛来为平面上的所有像素着色，这就是你得到的。

input: So what you're looking at right now, the axes aren't labeled, but the real axis is running across the middle of the screen from around negative 4.5 up to I think 3, and then the imaginary axis that's going from I think negative 2i up to 2i.
translatedText: 所以你现在看到的，轴没有被标记，但真实的轴从负 4 附近穿过屏幕的中间。5 到我认为的 3，然后是从我认为的负 2i 到 2i 的虚轴。

input: So this horizontal part of blackness corresponds to all the values that converge that we just found, where the upper bound was e to the 1 over e, and the lower bound is what you can find for homework if you want.
translatedText: 因此，黑色的水平部分对应于我们刚刚找到的所有收敛值，其中上限是 e 到 e 上的 1，下限是您可以在家庭作业中找到的值（如果您愿意）。

input: But the other values above that diverge, and the coloring tells you how quickly they diverge.
translatedText: 但高于该值的其他值会出现分歧，并且颜色会告诉您它们分歧的速度。

input: So yellow means that it explodes very quickly, blue means that it explodes less quickly, and so on.
translatedText: 所以黄色意味着它爆炸得非常快，蓝色意味着它爆炸得慢，依此类推。

input: And so evidently what happens is as you allow for complex numbers, even if their real part is greater than e to the 1 over e, that imaginary part can conspire in just such a way that it makes it converge, and you get this totally intricate pattern, very analogous to the Mandelbrot set, which is also defined in terms of a certain repeated operation.
translatedText: 显然，当你考虑复数时，即使它们的实部大于 e 到 e 上的 1，虚部也可以以某种方式聚合，使其收敛，你会得到这个完全复杂的结果模式，与曼德尔布罗特 集非常相似，曼德尔布罗特集也是根据某个重复操作来定义的。

input: And what this indicates is there's actually a lot more intricacy than you might expect associated with these power towers and this titration operation.
translatedText: 这表明这些发电塔和滴定操作实际上比您想象的要复杂得多。

input: And you get this a lot where repeated applications of something can yield chaos, and that chaos is often pictorially reflected in the fact that a fractal emerges, and it's kind of like the intricacy of the image is paralleled in the difficulty of predicting what the outputs are going to be.
translatedText: 你会发现很多这样的情况，重复应用某些东西会产生混乱，而这种混乱通常通过分形出现的事实来形象地反映出来，这有点像图像的复杂性与预测输出的难度是并行的将会是。

input: And just to illustrate the fact that the outputs can be difficult to predict, you want to know what an unsolved problem is, what no one in the world actually knows, is if you can ever take a power tower with pis, so pi to the power pi to the power pi to the power pi, you do that.
translatedText: 只是为了说明输出可能难以预测的事实，您想知道什么是未解决的问题，世界上没有人真正知道的是，您是否可以使用 pi 来建造一座电力塔，因此 pi 到幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi 幂 pi

input: At any point, is this ever equal to an integer?
translatedText: 在任何时候，这是否等于整数？

input: Almost certainly not, it would seem highly unlikely because it's an irrational number and if you're thinking of it kind of probabilistically, but it's not probabilistic, it's a deterministic process.
translatedText: 几乎肯定不会，这看起来不太可能，因为它是一个无理数，如果你从概率的角度思考它，但它不是概率性的，而是一个确定性的过程。

input: In fact, we don't even know for a power tower of height 4, if there's just 4 pis here, you take pi to the power pi, pi to the power of that, pi to the power of that, it ends up being a monstrous number, bigger than we can compute exactly.
translatedText: 事实上，我们甚至不知道对于高度为 4 的能量塔，如果这里只有 4 个 pi，你将 pi 的 pi 次方，pi 的 pi 次方，pi 的 pi 次方，最终得到这是一个巨大的数字，超出了我们精确计算的范围。

input: We don't have a way to prove whether or not this is an integer.
translatedText: 我们没有办法证明这是否是一个整数。

input: And if you can prove that, you know, you will be contributing to the forefront of math.
translatedText: 如果你能证明这一点，你就会知道，你将为数学的前沿做出贡献。

input: That's the level of what we actually don't know about these power towers, which I think is kind of interesting.
translatedText: 这就是我们对这些电力塔实际上不了解的程度，我认为这很有趣。

input: Can I share the brainteaser where the arrow operator shows up?

translatedText: 我认为这是来自 IMO，这是 Po Chen-Lo 曾与我分享过的东西，我确信他在某个地方对此进行了谈论，这比我可以即时谈论的内容更具说明性这里。

input: But the way this will work is that we have 6 different cups, and each cup is going to start out with a single coin in it.
translatedText: 但这的运作方式是，我们有 6 个不同的杯子，每个杯子一开始都会有一枚硬币。

input: One of those operations is that you can remove the coin from one cup, so we'll remove it from one cup, but then two more coins will drop into the cup to its right.
translatedText: 其中一项操作是，您可以从一个杯子中取出硬币，因此我们将从一个杯子中取出硬币，但随后另外两枚硬币会落入其右侧的杯子中。

input: So there's a certain directionality to this.

input: Two more will drop into the one to its right.

input: So you could imagine from here we could then eliminate all three coins, and then there would be six that just magically drop in.

input: If you just sort of keep doing this process of taking out coins, doubling it, but shifted one over, you can get up to 63.

input: Now if I introduce the second magical operation, which is that I can eliminate one of the coins in a cup, and instead of magically dropping two into the next one, I swap the two that are sitting right after it.
translatedText: 现在，如果我介绍第二个神奇的操作，那就是我可以消除杯子中的一枚硬币，而不是神奇地将两枚硬币放入下一枚硬币中，而是交换紧随其后的两枚硬币。

input: I swap their positions.
translatedText: 我交换他们的位置。

input: That's the second power that you have, which seems less magical because it doesn't require bringing about coins from the ether.
translatedText: 这是你拥有的第二种力量，它看起来不那么神奇，因为它不需要从以太中带来硬币。

input: I think the way that this was originally framed is, is the maximum amount of money that you can have after doing this process bigger or smaller than 2010 to the power 2010 to the power 2010?

translatedText: 当你拥有这两种能力时，你从六个杯子开始，每个杯子里有一枚硬币，它会更大吗？如果你足够聪明，你可以获得的最大金钱，比那个能量塔更大还是更小身高三？

translatedText: 再说一遍，第二次操作会让你接近这个数字水平，这有点荒谬，因为我的意思是，这实在是太大了。

input: It's way bigger than anything you'll find in physics.

input: Unless you're doing statistical mechanics or something like that.

input: And with that, unless there's anything more that people want to ask and which also ends up getting forwarded to me, I think I'm going to go ahead and call it a day on this one.

translatedText: 当您求解 X 到 X 到 X on 和 on 等于 2 并得到 X 平方等于 2 时，您忽略了 2 的负平方根。

translatedText: 惊人的。

translatedText: 让我们再次以图形方式思考这个问题，这有助于我们在迭代过程中更加具体地了解迭代过程中发生的情况。

input: When I said B equal to around one point four one.

input: OK.

input: There's not even necessarily a an intersection at that point.

input: So the reason we were taking square roots of two when we were looking at our power tower operations.
translatedText: 这就是我们在研究电力塔运营时取二的平方根的原因。

input: If we remind ourselves.

input: We had the assumption that there even exists an answer.

input: This whole thing, no, not with an X at the top, it just goes up to infinity equals two.

input: Let's think about what this would mean.
translatedText: 让我们想想这意味着什么。

input: What do we mean to have a negative square root here?
translatedText: 这里的负平方根是什么意思？

input: Well, I guess what you'd be assuming is that you you're taking negative powers.
translatedText: 好吧，我猜你会假设你正在获得负面权力。

input: Now that I think about it, if we said X equal to the negative square root of two.
translatedText: 现在我想一下，如果我们说 X 等于 2 的负平方根。

input: Then you'd be raising it in the next process.
translatedText: 然后你会在下一个过程中提出它。

input: You would take negative square root of two.
translatedText: 你会取二的负平方根。

input: You would raise it to a negative power.
translatedText: 你会把它提高到负数。

input: OK, so raising to a negative power.
translatedText: 好的，所以提高到负幂。

input: We're already in the realm of thinking about negative square root of two to the one over.
translatedText: 我们已经开始思考二除一的负平方根。

input: No, negative one over square root of two to the square root of two.
translatedText: 不，负一除以二的平方根除以二的平方根。

input: Why doesn't that end up popping up in the intersection or anything like that?
translatedText: 为什么它最终不会出现在十字路口或类似的地方？

input: Actually, the more I think about it, there might be a very obvious answer to what's going on that I'm missing.
translatedText: 事实上，我想得越多，对于我所错过的事情可能有一个非常明显的答案。

input: Other than I mean, we can talk about.
translatedText: 除了我的意思，我们可以谈谈。

input: We can talk about the fact that negative numbers don't sit in the range of convergence.
translatedText: 我们可以讨论负数不在收敛范围内的事实。

input: Like if you solve the homework problem, the assumption that there exists an X that's negative that converges like this would be false.
translatedText: 就像如果你解决家庭作业问题一样，存在一个像这样收敛的负 X 的假设是错误的。

input: Because you'll find that the the bound ends up.
translatedText: 因为你会发现界限结束了。

input: I think it ends up being E to the negative E.
translatedText: 我认为最终结果是E到负E。

input: So in the same way that it failed, our logic failed in the case of four.
translatedText: 因此，就像它失败一样，我们的逻辑在四的情况下也失败了。

input: Our logic fails if we just plug in square root of negative two.
translatedText: 如果我们只代入负二的平方根，我们的逻辑就会失败。

input: I'm kind of curious if that breaks down numerically.
translatedText: 我有点好奇这是否会在数字上崩溃。

input: So if we do try this over in our python, let's again set equal to one.
translatedText: 因此，如果我们确实在 Python 中尝试此操作，请再次设置为等于 1。

input: Let's find our for loop.
translatedText: 让我们找到 for 循环。

input: Now we're going to do the negative square root of two and repeat the process.
translatedText: 现在我们要计算 2 的负平方根并重复该过程。

input: Yeah, what do we get?
translatedText: 是啊，我们得到什么？

input: We do get a stable point.
translatedText: 我们确实得到了一个稳定的点。

input: Interesting.
translatedText: 有趣的。

input: Negative square root of two.
translatedText: 2 的负平方根。

input: You look like you're a very stable point.
translatedText: 看起来你是一个非常稳定的点。

input: You're not a stable point that's equal to two at all.
translatedText: 你根本不是一个等于二的稳定点。

input: What is that number?
translatedText: 那个数字是多少？

input: What's going on there?
translatedText: 那里发生了什么事？

input: You know what?
translatedText: 你知道吗？

input: I'm not entirely positive.
translatedText: 我并不完全乐观。

input: Now I have a decision to make.
translatedText: 现在我要做出决定。

input: Do I try to think about what exactly is going on on screen live rather than just calling it into the stream?
translatedText: 我是否尝试思考屏幕上到底发生了什么，而不是仅仅将其调用到流中？

input: Or do I think about it and then pin that to a comment at the end?
translatedText: 或者我是否考虑一下然后将其固定在最后的评论中？

input: Let's see.
translatedText: 让我们来看看。

input: What's going on with our logic exactly?
translatedText: 我们的逻辑究竟是怎么回事？

input: We're saying assume that there equals a value that converges to two.
translatedText: 我们说的是假设有一个值收敛到二。

input: If there does, it's going to satisfy this property.
translatedText: 如果有的话，它将满足这个属性。

input: I mean, because I guess what you can say is it's like x equals plus or minus square root of two.
translatedText: 我的意思是，因为我猜你可以说 x 等于加或减 2 的平方根。

input: You try them both.
translatedText: 你两个都试试。

input: One of them equals, one of them doesn't.
translatedText: 其中之一相等，其中之一不相等。

input: End of story.
translatedText: 故事结局。

input: I mean, this happens a lot when you're doing something algebraic.
translatedText: 我的意思是，当你做代数题时，这种情况经常发生。

input: You have a manipulation like this.
translatedText: 你有这样的操纵。

input: You have multiple possibilities, but you just kind of plug them into check and one of them just doesn't work.
translatedText: 你有多种可能性，但你只是将它们插入检查，其中一种就行不通。

input: But that's always very unsatisfying because what you want is some sort of answer to why it looked like it was going to work but didn't.
translatedText: 但这总是非常令人不满意，因为你想要的是某种答案，解释为什么它看起来会起作用，但没有。

input: So in the case of a power tower that equals four, you could very clearly see why it didn't.
translatedText: 因此，在能量塔等于四的情况下，你可以非常清楚地明白为什么它没有。

input: The assumption that it even converged was false.
translatedText: 甚至收敛的假设也是错误的。

input: And I guess in this case our assumption would be if we had negative root two, if we have a negative value, that what's sitting up here is still equal to two.
translatedText: 我想在这种情况下，我们的假设是，如果我们有负根二，如果我们有负值，那么这里的值仍然等于二。

input: I don't know.
translatedText: 我不知道。

input: We saw that it doesn't.
translatedText: 我们发现事实并非如此。

input: We can say when you're doing this, you try them both and if one of them doesn't, that's all it is.
translatedText: 我们可以说，当你这样做时，你会尝试两者，如果其中之一没有，那就是这样了。

input: But that just doesn't feel satisfying to me.
translatedText: 但这对我来说并不令人满意。

input: So I'll think about that a little bit.
translatedText: 所以我会考虑一下。

input: If anyone has deeper thoughts, share them in the comments of course.
translatedText: 如果有人有更深入的想法，当然可以在评论中分享。

input: I would love to hear what you have to say as sort of a like what's going on with the square root of negative two.
translatedText: 我很想听听你要说什么，就像负二的平方根发生了什么一样。

input: What does it converge to and why does it have any relation to this process?
translatedText: 它收敛到什么以及为什么它与这个过程有关系？

input: Which as we already saw is a faulty line of reasoning and like a little bit shaky to just replace what's inside your infinite power tower with the assumptions you've already made.
translatedText: 正如我们已经看到的，这是一个错误的推理路线，并且用您已经做出的假设替换无限能量塔内的内容有点不稳定。

input: Yeah, I'll think on that.
translatedText: 是的，我会考虑一下。

input: Excellent question and I think that's a great place to end it.
translatedText: 这是一个很好的问题，我认为这是结束它的好地方。

input: Also, I couldn't help but notice the Twitter handle for who is asking that because this is someone who's created these super beautiful notes for all of the Lockdown series so far.
translatedText: 另外，我忍不住注意到了问这个问题的 Twitter 账号，因为到目前为止，这个人已经为所有“封锁”系列创建了这些超级漂亮的笔记。

input: Which I've been throwing in the video descriptions just because I'm like, yeah, this is, boy do I wish my handwriting looked anything like that.
translatedText: 我之所以在视频描述中添加这些内容，只是因为我想，是的，这就是，我希望我的笔迹看起来像那样。

input: So if anyone wants to check them out, she's done a beautiful job.
translatedText: 因此，如果有人想检查一下，她做得很好。

input: And with that I will actually call it an end to today's lesson.
translatedText: 我今天的课程就到此结束了。

input: I'll see you at Friday at the same time for our second to last in the Lockdown Math series.
translatedText: 我将在周五同一时间与您见面，这是我们锁定数学系列的倒数第二部分。
